fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37680].
  {panel}

Scenario:

User1 From DirectoryA, Group A

User2 From DirectoryB GroupB

Only GroupA can login to confluence.

Currently, Aggregating membership only works if the user exists in Both Directory.

It will be nice if we add user2 to GroupA, so that he can be authenticated.
fields.summary: Cross directory Membership
View list of in-line comments on page/spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37670].
  {panel}

I refer to this tweet:
https://twitter.com/developerjack/status/602764917956018176

In one installation we use Confluence in an academic environment.  We require the academics group (from JIRA user directory) to be given read and comment access to all personal spaces (journals and learning diaries etc).

Currently the only solution I could find was to add these users to global confluence admins to be able to comment on old spaces (or I could manually adjust each space which is a huge time sink)
fields.summary: Globally add group permissions to personal spaces OR permission schemes
Editing mode header jumplist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37668].
  {panel}

This would be exactly like [this request for JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30708].

Certain customers have huge user directories and need to identify which users have been inactive in the last months to disable them and don't count as a user license.

To identify these inactive users, we follow the instructions of [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+identify+inactive+users+in+Confluence+by+last+login+date]. After this step, you have a list of, for example, 500 inactive users that should be unable.

It would be perfect to be able to list all users, and then bulk disable the inactive users on this list.

The current workaround for this is using the [Command Line Interface plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cli].
fields.summary: Disable multiple users in Confluence
Deleted text that contained a resolved inline comment cannot be re-opened to delete
Extending the Reorder Pages Feature to Supports Descending Page Reordering
Confluence Profile Picture Icons missing representation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37661].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some organisation store sensitive information in their Confluence. While they can  guard it by user access levels, they have no control over email notification that are sent which might be prone to third party interception.  They would 


h3. Suggested Solution
# Show changed content can be disable from the global level and cannot be enable back from the user level once it is disable. 
# Allow an option to show only the status notification but the actual content which are added or modified. 
# Applicable to all Confluence content including comment.  


h3. Workaround 
(!) Please note, this workaround is provided by a user and  has not been officiallly tested by Atlassian
[^RBDEV-ConfluenceEmailTemplates-090515-2155-17.pdf]
fields.summary: Provide the ability to Limit the  Content of Notification Emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37655].
  {panel}

In [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+a+Dedicated+User+Account+on+the+Operating+System+to+Run+Confluence], it is mentioned that:
bq. (!) Do not make the Confluence Installation Directory itself writeable by the dedicated user account.

However, there are known issues which was caused by the lack permissions to the Confluence Home or Installation directories, e.g. [Confluence does not start due to Spring Application context has not been set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+does+not+start+due+to+Spring+Application+context+has+not+been+set].

Therefore, could we get this documentation to be updated to ensure that the user running Confluence has full read/write/execute permissions to the Confluence Installation and Home directories?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Update on "Creating a Dedicated User Account on the Operating System to Run Confluence" Documentation
Provide Auto-Complete functionality for the Space Category Textbox
Suggested Space Categories should offer a means to show all space categories
Roadmap Planner Macro: Granularity down to days.
Improve documentaiton of Confluence Questions permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When customer have several page templates for different teams, all these members will be able to see those templates.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be good if there was a way to add some group/user based view restrictions so those teams would view only the templates they need to use instead of all available templates in a space.
fields.summary: Add view restrictions for global/space templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37636]. {panel} The rule in HTML5 is one h1 per Sectioning Element Tag (E.G.
, ,
). When using Sections with their own header structure, the following Wiki code: {code} {section} h1. Title Some description h2. Topic h3. SubTopic Text. h2. Topic h3.SubTopic {section} h1. Title h2. Topic Text {code} Should render as: {code:html}

Title

Some description

Topic

SubTopic

Text.

Topic

SubTopic

Title

Topic

Text.

{code} When it invalidly renders more like: {code:html}

Title

Some description

Topic

SubTopic

Text.

Topic

SubTopic

Title

Topic

Text.

{code}
fields.summary: Section elements should create <section> HTML5 tags
Ship Confluence with the latest Java
Add a link to the existing page in the A page already exists error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37624].
  {panel}

*Current behavior*
Currently page permissions seem to blanket a parent page and its children. If permissions are set on a child page, these permissions apply to the parent as well and vise versa.

*Requested behavior*
When applying permissions to a child page, the parent page should not take on these permissions.

*Use case*
Customer wants parent page to be hidden from anonymous access but wants a child page to be visible. Currently this is not possible in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow for better handling of child page permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37623].
  {panel}

When you try to upload a file/image into a Template (both Global and Space Template), you only have the option to insert a URL of a file or insert a file that is attached into another Space.

In a page, you can upload a File/Image.

Would be important to have the possibility to also upload files into Template.

Please refer to the images attached.
fields.summary: Upload files into a Template
Improvement to Task Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37621].
  {panel}

*Situation*
When adding code blocks to a Confluence page, it is common to collapse the code block macro to save page space. At times, users may want to added a collapsed code block macro inside an expand macro. This does not work as expected when expanding the code block macro.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Create Confluence page
* Add expand macro to the page
* Add code block macro inside of expand macro
* Select the collapsable option
* Save the page
* Expand the expand macro
* Expand the code block macro
* Code block macro opens and disappears


*Expected behavior*

Code should be displayed when expanding the code block macro


*Actual behavior*

Code block macro disappears when expanding



Video attached of this behavior
fields.summary: Collapsed code block macro does not render correctly in parent expand macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37619]. {panel} h3. Summary Creating a user macro with text formatting in Confluence will not work if there is a multiple lines. h3. How to replicate: # Create a user macro like [noprint macro| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Example+User+Macro+-+NoPrint] (in this example, I have created a redcolor macro) #* Define its Template as {code}## @noparams
$body
{code} # Define its formatting in both (in this example, formatting is giving the font color red and a font size): #* PDF Export Stylesheet #* Space Stylesheet !Capture.PNG! # Call this user macro in a page as so: !Capture1.PNG! # Export this page to PDF h3. What is expected: PDF export is the same as displayed in Confluence page (because of the same formatting defined in Space stylesheet and PDF Export stylesheet) h3. What actually happens: Only the user macro that contains 1 lines work. The one with multiple lines does not have formatting anymore: !Capture2.PNG! h3. Causes One line text with the macro, will return the element: {code}
one line
{code} As you can see, the text "one line" is directly enclosed under the element with the class "redcolor" However if there are more than one line, the text will be enclosed in the

element. {code}

one line

two line

{code} Somehow, the pdf css is not apply to the element which are not directly enclosed in the element class. h3. What CSS formattings are affected: color font-size h3. Workaround: As a workaround, add the following code so

element diretly under the class will be affected by the css {code} .redcolor p { color:red } {code} You will need to add two css in the pdf css so it will work for both of the scenario: !Capture3.PNG!
fields.summary: Multiple lines in user macro breaks its formatting when exported to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37614].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
Currently Confluence does not seem to have a timeout when attempting to load macros that are either blocked, or are taking a long time to load. This can lead the end user to a never ending loading page.

*Expected Behavior*
Confluence should set a timeout for the macro to load on the client side, and one the number is met an error should be thrown containing a relevant message.
fields.summary: Add Macro Timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37610].
  {panel}

h6. Situation:
Having more than 2 nested panels in Confluence editor causes difficulties in selection. Observed behavors includes:
* Upon clicking for a location with a cursor, the page jumps and flickers
* Copying and pasting on a parent panel will result in pasted in children panel
* Image Edit Bar does not get displayed

h6. Browser Environment Affected:
* IE 11

h6. Replicated on:
* 5.7.4
* 5.8-OD-50-011

h6. For more information, see screencast attached
fields.summary: Nested Panels Causes Selection Difficulties while using IE
Add support for "mentioning" locations similar to @user feature
Attachment support for Apple Pages and Keynote format files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37601].
  {panel}

h3. User case:

Space was infected by a spamers and inserted thousands of comments with anonymous user and the confluence is very slowly. But now i need to delete all comments from anonymous users of  a space.

h3. Workaround:

!) Backup the database and filesystem before attempting the below SQL. [Production backup strategy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Production+Backup+Strategy] does into detail on the best practice for this. 

Run the following SQL and copy the value of the oldest timestamp from when the spammer started creating comments:

{code}select contenttype, creationdate from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null 
order by creationdate{code} 

We'll use this in the following SQL queries where I had the placeholder <TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>.

The following will remove *all* comments created by anonymous users across the entire Confluence instance created after the timestamp we found in the first SQL query. If needed, we could add a second condition on creationdate to only delete comments created before a certain date if you've had legitimate anonymous comments created since the spam. 

{code}delete from bodycontent where contentid in (select content.contentid from content 
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate >= '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');

delete from contentproperties where contentid in (select content.contentid from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate > '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');


{code}delete from links where contentid in (select content.contentid from content 
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate >= '2015-05-17 13:42:34.607');{code}

delete from content where contentid in (select content.contentid from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate > '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');{code}
fields.summary: Ability to delete all comments from a space.
semut jepang

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37594].
  {panel}

*Background*
User is not able to complete the PDF export and the below error is found in the logs

{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Exception thrown while rendering the page 'no title found' to the PDF document /media/data0/confluence-home/temp/pdfexport-20150518-180515-1654-11/km-180515-1654-12.pdf
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.createPdfForSpace(FlyingSaucerPdfExporterService.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:72)
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.PdfExportLongRunningTask.runInternal(PdfExportLongRunningTask.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:27)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:58)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.ConfluenceExportUserAgent.resolveAndOpenStream(ConfluenceExportUserAgent.java:112)
        at org.xhtmlrenderer.swing.NaiveUserAgent.getBinaryResource(NaiveUserAgent.java:223)
        at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextFontResolver.importFontFaces(ITextFontResolver.java:97)
        at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.setDocument(ITextRenderer.java:178)
        at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.setDocument(ITextRenderer.java:142)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.convertXhtmlToPdf(FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter.java:74)
        ... 12 more
{noformat}

*Expectation*
# Better logging so we can identify the page that is causing this
# Handle the NullPointerException so that the export does not fail completely i.e. the export completes without pages causing this exception.
fields.summary: Better exception handling for pdf export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37593].
  {panel}

h3. Idea
I think the way [Stack Exchange|http://stackexchange.com/] is handling its user comments is the best way from a user experience perspective. What Stack Exchange provides (and I am pretty sure every developer on this planet knows this) is a two-level comment functionality with a main comment on level 1 and any amount of sub comments to the given main comment on level 2. Level 0 is the question.

h3. New Confluence feature
In Confluence, Level 0 is the Confluence page or blog post. Level 1 should be the main comment, level 1 the sub comments.
In addition, each confluence user should be able to sort the main comments by date decending or ascending. In this context please refer to [CONF-2587|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2587]. The sorting should have no effect on the sub comments.

*For ascending sort order.*
>PAGE OR BLOG POST
>> Main comment 1
>>> Sub comment 1.1
>>> Sub comment 1.2
>>> ...
>> Main comment 2
>>> Sub comment 2.1
>>> Sub comment 2.2
>>> ...
...

*For descending sort order.*
>PAGE OR BLOG POST
>> Main comment 2
>>> Sub comment 2.1
>>> Sub comment 2.2
>>> ...
>> Main comment 1
>>> Sub comment 1.1
>>> Sub comment 1.2
>>> ...
...
fields.summary: Two level comment system instead of (or in addition to) threaded comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37589].
  {panel}

The rendering time for Confluence page with Office Word Macro increases tremendously when the size of the word document increases.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Attach one of the following attachment (each test) - [^Simple.docx] (4KB) & [^Complex.docx] (2.76MB)
# Insert the document as Office Word Macro.
# Save the page.
# Observe the loading time.

h3. Observations
Confluence takes approximately 1.5 seconds to save a page with a document size of 4KB.
{code}[atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] log [1455ms] - /confluence/display/SAN/Simple+Docx{code}
It takes approximately 12 seconds to save a page with a document size of 2.76MB
{code}[atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] log [11646ms] - /confluence/display/SAN/Complex+Docx{code}
(i) It can easily takes up to 20 seconds to save a page with a document size of more than 5MB and so forth.
fields.summary: Office Word Macro Rendering Performance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37586].
  {panel}

h6. What happens:
Pages that contains more than 100 attachments seems to break the indexing of the attachments. Searching for the 101st and above attachments does not seem to work

h6. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new page, 
# Go to Tools > Attachment
# Attach 104 PDFs
# Copy the 101st PDF title (The 101st PDF is the first PDF listed in the 6th page) 
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
# Paste to the search bar, click on the suggested result
!Capture1.PNG|thumbnail!, 
# Confluence not able to preview this PDF:
{code}
File can not be displayed
Error: File does not exist
{code}
!Capture2.PNG|thumbnail!
# All PDF before the 100th (that is located in the 5th and below pages) are fine

h6. What we have tried:
# Rebuilding index from Admin console
# Rebuilding index from scratch
# Viewing the said PDF itself is fine

h6. other notes:
* Replicated on Confluence 5.7.1, 5.7.4 and even Cloud version 5.8-OD-51-008
* Attached is a compressed version of a screencast
fields.summary: Attachments cannot be previewed if a page contains more than 100 attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37585].

Reproducing the missing functionality:
# I've added a PDF document to a file list.
# When I click on any links in the file list or on a search result list including the icon I am not shown a preview / commenting viedw but rather the old PDF rendered window.

Reproducing the wanted functionality:
# When I search for the PDF file in the global search, I can click on the icon and the preview / commenting view is shown.
fields.summary: Filelist icon links should also render documents for review like search icon links

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37569].
  {panel}

depending on how you try to add a link to an external site to a confluence page you get different results:

|| what you type || what you get: link text || what you get: actual link || what i expect: actual link || 
| {code}www.google.de{code} | www.google.de | http://www.google.de | http://www.google.de |
| {code}[www.google.de]{code} | www.google.de | $BASEURL/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=foo&title=www.google.de&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=$SOMEPAGE | http://www.google.de |
| {code}[test|www.google.de]{code} | www.google.de | $BASEURL/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=foo&title=test&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=$SOMEPAGE | http://www.google.de |
| {code}[test|http://www.google.de]{code} | test | http://www.google.de | http://www.google.de |

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37567].

There is question which already describes this issue:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/63733/is-it-possible-to-sort-global-spaces-in-confluence-non-alphabetically-but-with-ones-own-discretion

The global spaces in Confluence are sorted alphabetically, but i have a specific ordering I would like for them to be placed in.
Currently, We have placed numbers in front of each space 1, 10, 20, etc to sort them in the order that is needed.
Does anyone know if there is an option to sort them in any order?

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37564].
  {panel}

The confluence studio theme plugin uses deprecated Google apps integration for iGoogle gadget.
As we are removing all deprecated gapps code that uses OAUTH v1 apis, we would need to clean this up.

Please also see: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ROTP-3082

Reference: confluence-studio-project/confluence-studio-plugins/confluence-studio-theme-plugin/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37561].
  {panel}

Confluence, with the latest release, has matched JIRA in making the search menu darkened.  However, the search bar in JIRA as a highlight "Search" word in light grey to attract attention to it.  This is not there in Confluence and so it makes the search in the title bar very invisible.

My users have complained about this and to make this consistent across the tools I strongly recommend that the word "Search" be added to Confluence's search menu in the title bar.

Cheer and G'day,
Robert
fields.summary: New dark search bar missing "Search"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37560].
  {panel}

Would pretty useful to have a functionality on Confluence just like we have on Confluence Questions. You start typing the title of your Question/Page and a popup shows a search of related content.

It would avoid that users create pages with content that already exist.

Example provided by the customer:
"User A creates a page called "Git setup" and a few days later User B wants to create a page called "How to setup Git". Once they've put in the title I would like a pop up asking them if the page they are about to create is going to be a duplicate of the existing "Git setup" page."
fields.summary: Avoid duplicate pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37541].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a user wants to be able to include a page from a space (Space A) with restrictions to a space (Space B) that doesn't have the same restrictions, only those users with permissions to Space A will see the content, all other users will see a message that the macro is unable to render.

h3. Suggested Solution
Knowing that too drastic of a change could cause security issues, maybe add the ability for a space or site admin to waive permission checks on a case by case basis in the macro itself (a toggle or checkbox should do the trick). 

h3. Workaround 
Copy the page into a space that has fewer restrictions, and then include that page.
fields.summary: Add the ability to waive permissions checks for the include page macro
Broken Attachments in Documentation
Provide an option to prevent the HTML rendering Javascript
Display a specific error message when corrupted image isn't rendered
Export features available to Anonymous even though space permissions are set to not export
Add an option to trigger Mail Notifications when pages are Moved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37524].
  {panel}

Hi,

We are currently looking into alternative methods to manage authentication for Confluence, as the current setup is not suited very well for our needs.
We configured Confluence to use Active Directory for user/pass authentication.

We have an apache proxy running in front of it which would theoretically make it possible to let apache do the authentication and pass it to Confluence.
Therefor we would like to know about the possibility of using certificates to authenticate to Confluence.

An example of certificate based auth would be here:
http://www.impetus.us/~rjmooney/proj
ects/misc/clientcertauth.html

Is it possible to make this kind of authentication work together with Confluence?
We would be happy if you could point us to any information or documentation that would help us in this matter.


Thanks & Regards
fields.summary: Alternative methods to manage authentication?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37523].
  {panel}

Basic example AD setup is as follows:

{noformat}
Groups
 `- Security Groups
    `- Confluence
       `- Confluence Users
       `- Confluence ReadOnly Users
       `- Confluence Space1 Users
 `- Department Groups
    `- Department1
    `- Department2
{noformat}

We've set up the AD Base DN to the AD base, then set Additional Group DN to "OU=Confluence,OU=Groups".

Confluence now sees the 3 Confluence related groups only, without dumping all hundreds of groups we have in AD into the Confluence system, this works very well.

However, I've added Department1 and Department2 into the various Confluence groups, and they're not being recursed into, I assume because they are outside the Additional Group DN. This means no users are added into their groups, even though AD-wise, they are in there.

This is not a unique setup, and I've found a few other cases using Google running into the same issues.

It would be beneficial to just recurse through all groups given, regardless of Additional Group DN - or at least have an option to do so.
fields.summary: Active Directory/LDAP groups do not recurse outside group base
Use template variables in page title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37512].
  {panel}

h3. ***Summary*** 
Watchers of a page in Confluence will receive notifications of activities on the page even though they don't have view permission for the page.

h3. ***Expected Behavior***
Users that do not have view permission should not receive notifications for the page.

h3. ***Workaround***
Remove users from the watcher list
fields.summary: Page Watchers without View Permission is Receiving Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37478].
  {panel}

If this report is in the wrong section, please accept my apologies - I followed the link from the relevant cPanel documentation.

I've been trying to set up a filter. Using just my filter text in the Filter Trace, the text is trapped (as it should be).
When I include the complete source of an example email (where the filter text is at the very bottom), the text isn't trapped.
My host suggested it could the to do with the size of the email, but this doesn't appear to be the case.

The filter text I have tried is:
"respecting the legal rights regarding e-mail marketing"

An example email source in a text file is included.
fields.summary: CPanel Account Level Filter fails with long emails containing multiple nested table elements.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37474].
  {panel}

h6. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page in *IE 11*.
# Insert Table and type something in the first column.
# Press tab to go to the next column.
# Type something.

h6. Actual Behavior:
Column doesn't show anything while you are on the edit mode. It shows the text when you save the page.

h6. Expected Behavior:

It should shows the text.

h6. Workaround:
Click somewhere out of the table and start typing.
or
use backspace or delete after using tab and start typing.

h6. Notes
Re-editing the page does not have this issue, cells can be used without error.
fields.summary: Table doesn't show the text if you go to next column by using tab in IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37469].
  {panel}

In Confluence, while in Edit Mode, you have the option to use the Date picker (//) in order to display a Calendar and select a day to insert in the page. 

However, it will only display the day and the year, not pointing which weekday would be. For example, the following screenshots:

To display the Calendar with the days:

!date.png!

Then, once you have selected the day, here's what it looks like:

!may.png!

This is an improvement request to also display the weekday, once the date is inserted.
fields.summary: Display Weekday in Date Picker
Display Weekday in Confluence Date Picker

Advance Autowatch configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37461].
  {panel}

The upgrade procedure for Confluence datacenter:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Data+Center
specifies that you must stop all nodes in a cluster before upgrading confluence.

For enterprises where uptime on Confluence is really important, it would be really valuable if we could carry out live rolling upgrades, where we can take a single node down, upgrade it, bring it up and then upgrade the remaining nodes one by one.

I can understand that if the upgrade requires significant database schema changes that it might be harder to implement, but for minor version upgrades i would have thought this would be possible.
fields.summary: Allow rolling upgrade in Confluence Datacenter
Wrong timezones for all Russian cities and Belarus as well.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37456].
  {panel}

Looking at my task list in 
https://-HOSTNAME-/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action

One of the page links gives a Page Not found response. 

This is because the page uses the pageId=xxx query parameter due to the page title (contains a slash). Unfortunately the task list appends a query parameter with ?focusedTaskId=yyy and assumes that they page link does not already have a query parameter. Thus the link ends up with to ? characters

https://-HOSTNAME-/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2454034594?focusedTaskId=6

which gives a page not found.
fields.summary: Task listing can be broken

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37452].

h3. Summary
Confluence 5.8 OD will not startup, as it comes with Java 7 JRE embedded and set as the default

h3. Environment
* Automated installer version (.bin in Linux, .exe in Windows) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8 OD from installer
# Attempt to access Confluence in the browser

h3. Expected Results
You are greeted with the Confluence setup wizard

h3. Actual Results
Confluence doesn't start, there is a an error in the browser.

	... 9 more

	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
	... 11 more
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* I looked into what JRE is included and the notes indicate it is Java 7

h3. Workaround
# Install Java 8
# Go to <confluence_install>/bin
# Edit setenv.sh (or modify tomcat7w in Windows)
# Remove the JRE_HOME line and replace with {code}export JAVA_HOME=/path/to/java/8{code}
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence 5.8 OD has unsupported Java 7 JRE embedded, will not startup when installed using automated installer
Ability to create Nested Groups on Confluence Internal Directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37446].
  {panel}

Depending on the size that you adjust the Multimedia macro width, it will display a button to make the video to go fullscreen:

!screen.png!

However, instead of having the macro going fullscreen, we have the browser facing the change and the mp4 video will not render at all:

!video.png!
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro Fullscreen option in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37444].
  {panel}

*Bug Description*

When "Page Properties Report" macro returned list that are more than the "Number of items to display" (which by default is 30), it won't be able to refresh the content when user toggle in between the page list.

*How to replicate the bug*

# Create 30 pages that contain page properties macro
# Create a page properties macro with "Number of items to display" set to 20 (or a number that makes the table larger than the browser window height)
# Save the page
# "Page Properties Macro" should provide 2 pages of list to list down the page properties macro data
# Click the page "2" button in the "Page Properties Report Macro"
# Click the page "1" button in the "Page Properties Report Macro" to go back to the previous list

*Expected Behaviour*

"Page Properties Report" macro should be able to listed the data on both pages of list without issue

*Resulted Behaviour*

"Page Properties Report" macro unable to render the second page of list and when user click "1" to retrieve the previous page list, the macro unable to return the data. This probably means that the javascript that render the page list failed when user toggle in between page list.

*Notes:*

The problem appears when the table is larger than the browser viewport.

*Workaround*

Make sure the value of "Number of items to display" is higher than the total of page properties that it will returned. This workaround does not solve the issue in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: "Page Properties Report" macro unable to render the content when it returned multiple pages of list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37443].
  {panel}

Hello,

I want to install JIRA/Confluence/Stash with very strict security rules.  Have these products been through security validation/certification and penetration testing ?

If so, is it possible to get more information about that.

Emir
fields.summary: Confluence Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37442].
  {panel}

These are the questions I’d like to get to someone who knows Confluence well, either internally or at Atlassian.

1.	What is the functionality of labels/tags?  It seems I can tag a page to a label or tag a question to a label, but can I do a search against labels that will return me both?  For example, can I search for the label “Excel” and “Business Logic” and get back all of the pages and questions that are tagged with either/both?
2.	Can I control who can make labels and who can’t?  I want to enforce a certain amount of governance around this and don’t want the labels to devolve into a hairball of everyone making up new labels like high school kids make up new hashtags.

Thanks,
Emir
fields.summary: Some questions re: Confluence
Improve Confluence HipChat Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37433].
  {panel}

Using Chrome {{Version 42.0.2311.90 (64-bit)}}, the only files that seem to work when using the Multimedia Macro on Confluence are .mp3 and .mp4 files. 

.mov, .wma, .ram, .avi and .mpg do not work for Chrome.

Using Firefox {{36.0}} and Safari {{Version 8.0.5 (10600.5.17)}}, .mp3, .mp4, .mpg and .mov files work.

.wma, .ram and .avi do not work for Firefox and Safari.

See: [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Multimedia+Macro]
fields.summary: Update Multimedia Documentation To Show Supported Formats

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37432].
  {panel}

Customer requests the possibility to be able to set multiple parent pages for the same child pages.

This would work like having the same page listed behind different parent pages, but all these child should link to the same original URL of the page.

There was a [previous request for this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2789] but as it's pretty "old" and has been closed I decided to create a new one. :)

Thanks.
fields.summary: Assign multiple parent pages for the same child page
Naming Conventions in Cloud and Server Documentation Are Not Uniform
